events.name: Maximum New York April Party & Abundance Politics Accelerator
events.description: ​Come hang out with friends, hear some lightning talks about NYC city/state politics, find collaborators for your own political schemes, and have a good time!​You'll enjoy the company of MNY alumni, people from theabundance movementgenerally, and other guests.​This event will also feature a brief graduation ceremony for several cohorts ofThe Foundations of New York City!​There will be drinks and snacks!​Know before you arrive:This event will be guided by thefour rules of etiquettethat guide all Maximum New York classes, and is generally for people who mostly agree withThe Sensible Seventy.

events.name: OTWC Season 6: Kickoff
events.description: ​Join us for our first session Season 6!OTWC is an NYC-based writing community for writers to write, exchange ideas, and get inspired. Our sessions look like this:​​​​​​1. ​​​Introduce yourselves and talk about what you plan to write2. ​​​Focused writing session3. ​​​Get together in small groups and discuss how the session went​​​​​​Snacks and drinks will be provided!​​​​​If this price is too steep for you for any reason, email us by clicking "Contact the Host" on the left and we’ll give you a pay-what-you-can ticket.​​​​​​Follow us on Twitter and Instagram @otwc_nyc to stay updated on future events and announcements!​​​​​​Hope to see you there 🥳

venue.name: Please register to see the exact location of this event.

events.name: 106th NY Hardware Meetup @ Cornell Tech
events.description: ​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 106th NY Hardware Meetup at Cornell Tech​​​​Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.​​​​This month we'll be atCornell Tech. Cornell Tech is  Cornell University’s state-of-the-art campus in New York City that develops leaders and technologies for the AI era through foundational and applied research, graduate education, and new ventures. Located on Roosevelt Island, the growing campus was founded in partnership with the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology and in close collaboration with the NYC Economic Development Corporation after Cornell won a worldwide competition initiated by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration to create an applied sciences campus in New York City. More than 1,000 Cornell students are now educated annually on the campus, including 700 in Cornell Tech programs. Since opening in 2012, nearly 120 new companies have spun out from startup programs at Cornell Tech, and 95 percent of them are based in New York City. Cornell Tech continues to have atransformative economic impact on the region’s tech sector.​​​AGENDA​​​​6:30 - Arrival, presentation of student demos​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​​7:15- Community open mic​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on​7:30 - Panel with audience Q+A​​8:40 - Student demos, makerlab tours, mix and mingle​​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: 105th NY Hardware Meetup @ Viam
events.description: ​​​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 104th NY Hardware Meetup at Viam​​​Hardware Meetups happen across 30+ cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other. You might not realize it, but NYC is a hotbed for this kind of innovation and tonight you'll meet two companies working at the cutting edge of this technology.​​​This month we'll be atViam. Viam helps companies unlock the power of AI, data and automation in the physical world. They provide a single platform for engineers of all disciplines to solve problems together and build solutions that are fast and future-proof. Viam powers solutions across robotics, food and beverage, climate tech, marine, industrial manufacturing, and more. Founded in 2020 by former MongoDB co-founder and CTO Eliot Horowitz, Viam is headquartered in New York City.​​AGENDA​​​6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+A​8:20 - Community open mic​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.​8:30 - Mix + mingle​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: La Creme de la STEM™ x Startup Grind DMV - Walk and Talk
events.description: ​Join La Creme de la STEM™ and Startup Grind for a relaxed evening of networking and conversation at our "Walk and Talk" event, happening during SelectUSA at the Gaylord National Resort & Convention Center. Whether you're an entrepreneur or investor located in the DMV area, or attending SelectUSA, this is your chance to connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build meaningful relationships in a casual, welcoming atmosphere.​This gathering is the perfect opportunity to unwind after a busy day, share your experiences, and explore new opportunities. We look forward to seeing you there!

events.name: Navigating AI in Women's Healthcare: Insights from VC & Founders
events.description: ​La Creme de la STEM™ is partnering with Columbia Healthcare Ventures and GenZ Tea for a panel featuring VCs and founders in the Women Healthcare industry. We will break down trends and challenges. Join us for an insightful evening!​Speakers:​Marion Siboni, CEO and Founder of La Creme de la STEM™​Elena Piskounova, Assistant Professor and Founder​NanaYaa Mensah-Thomas, MBA, CLT, Managing Partner - Founder of Purelite Ventures​Denali Dahl, PhD, CEO/Co-Founder of Kalia Health​This event is sponsored by N2 Water

events.name: Behind the Fundraising Scene: the Making of a Deal - VC/Founder Convo
events.description: ​Ever wondered what really goes on behind the scenes in the world of venture capital? Join us for a lively VC Fireside Chat hosted by Marion from La Creme de la STEM™ . We'll be demystifying the VC industry, sharing insider tips, and answering all your burning questions in a relaxed, friendly atmosphere.​Come mingle, learn, and connect with fellow entrepreneurs, investors, and innovators. Whether you're a seasoned founder or just curious about how venture capital works, this is your chance to get the inside scoop—no suits, no jargon, just real talk and good vibes. See you there!

events.name: GenZtea x Boss Me In: Gen Z Founder Match at Chief
events.description: ​Join a handpicked cohort of visionary Gen Z female founders for an intimate evening with members of Chief - the most exclusive private network for women executives at the VP and C-suite level, whose members lead organizations valued at over $800 billion collectively.​About the Event:​In Chief's prestigious Manhattan clubhouse, where membership is by invitation-only and has a waitlist of thousands, 20 carefully selected Gen Z female founders will have the opportunity to connect one-on-one with some of business's most influential women leaders. This meticulously curated evening brings together today's Fortune 500 executives with tomorrow's groundbreaking entrepreneurs.​Who Will Be There:​- Selected Gen Z Female Founders​- Chief Members (Women executives from Director to C-suite level at Fortune 500 companies, fastest-growing startups, and globally recognized brands)​Agenda:​-Intro/Welcome/Agenda-Coming Together-Pitch Each Other/Connect-Goal, in one hour, create impact together-Last 30 min, have each team present how they made impact right in that hour​About the Hosts:​Chief is the most coveted private membership network for senior women executives, with an acceptance rate lower than Harvard. Members include executives from companies like Google, Nike, Goldman Sachs, and other industry-defining organizations. Chief's highly vetted community represents the upper echelon of business leadership, with membership limited to executives at the highest levels of organizational influence.​Boss Me In is pioneering the future of intergenerational leadership, bridging the expertise gap between seasoned executives and emerging leaders through carefully curated connections and transformative experiences.​GenZtea, spanning 21 countries, represents the elite network of Gen Z founders, creators, and investors shaping tomorrow's business landscape. Their partnerships with prestigious institutions and luxury brands like Pace University and Kiehl's showcase their commitment to elevating the next generation of business leaders.​This is a once-in-a-career opportunity to join an evening of unparalleled access and connection.​[Apply Now - Limited to 20 Gen Z Founders]​Location: Chief's Private Members' Club, NYC​Due to the highly exclusive nature of this event, applications will undergo a rigorous review process. Selected participants will represent the most promising ventures and innovative thinking in their respective industries.

events.name: Gen Z NYC Founder & Creator Mixer
events.description: ​As we embrace spring in 2025, take a moment to celebrate your entrepreneurial journey with us in East Village! Join fellow ONE-OF-A-KIND Gen Z founders for an intimate evening of connection, inspiration, and well-deserved self-care at our April mixer.​So what the heck is GenZtea?GenZtea's Mission: Empowering Gen Z founders, creators, and investors to unlock their full potential through personal branding, community support, and innovative resources. We're building a global network of young builders who are not just invited into the room but are leading it.​Want to stay in the loop? Join our brand new newsletter athttps://genztea.beehiiv.com/subscribefor monthly deep dives with Gen Z lens, event updates, and community highlights! Reach is the new resume.​DM me if you are interested in getting featured in newsletter​✨ Brand New​✨: Gen Z Marketplace​DM me on Luma to have your food brand represented IRL at this event!​​🎁 Event Highlights:​​• Network with fellow Gen Z entrepreneurs & creators​​• Share experiences and insights​​• Discover potential collaborations​​• Enjoy refreshments​Want to sponsor? Reach out here on Luma or email natalie@thegenztea.com​​** Please note, this event will be photographed and filmed. GenZtea reserves the rights to use photographs and video from the event for marketing and communication purposes. By attending this event you consent to your image being used for these purposes and being added to GenZtea newsletter. **

events.name: Gen Z Cafe CoWorking
events.description: ​A mid-week coworking session perfect for those flexible WFH days and startup founders!​Join fellow Gen Z founders, creators, and investors for an energizing February coworking session in East Village. Whether you're building your startup, working on your side hustle, or just want to connect with like-minded creators – this space is for you.​What's GenZtea? 🍵​GenZtea empowers Gen Z founders to unlock their full potential through personal branding, community support, and innovative resources. We're building a global network of young entrepreneurs who are changing the world.​📍 What to Expect:​• A cozy workspace in a vibrant cafe setting​• Meaningful connections with fellow Gen Z entrepreneurs​• Collaborative brainstorming and experience sharing​• Winter-friendly amenities to stay productive​Stay Connected: ✨​Join our newsletter atgenztea.beehiiv.com/subscribefor monthly founder resources, event updates, and community highlights! ✨​Want to be featured in our community spotlight? DM us! 📱​Photo Notice: 📸 This event will be photographed and filmed. By attending, you consent to GenZtea using your image in marketing materials and adding you to the GenZtea newsletter.
